definition: ordinary/commonplace/mundane/temporal/of the material world (as opposed to supernatural or immortal levels)/every/all/whatever/altogether/gist/outline/note of Chinese musical scale
variant of 是[shi4]/(used in given names)

sentences.english: At a Chinese party the guests usually arrive 5-10 minutes early.
sentences.chinese: 中餐宴会客人凡是提前五至非常钟到达。

sentences.english: The latest edition of the citated document without date fit this standard.
sentences.chinese: 凡是不注日期的引用文件，最新版本适用于本标准。

sentences.english: Chinese people usually get together for a big dinner.
sentences.chinese: 中国人凡是聚在一同吃年夜餐。

sentences.english: Anyone who has imagined what life was like before the agrarian revolution can find out here.
sentences.chinese: 凡是能想象到的农业革命前的生活都能在这里重现。

sentences.english: All students should respect their teachers.
sentences.chinese: 凡是学生就应当尊敬老师。

sentences.english: Everything reactionary is the same; if you don't hit it, it won't fall.
sentences.chinese: 凡是反动的东西，你不打，他就不倒。

sentences.english: All the best allies to Yaka must be proven in the furnace of affliction.
sentences.chinese: 凡是雅卡的盟友都必须在战火的熔炉里接受试炼。

sentences.english: He thinks that everyone who believe will go to heaven.
sentences.chinese: 他认为凡是信神者都将进天堂。

sentences.english: But suppose someone asks us, 'Socrates and Diotima.
sentences.chinese: 请问，苏格拉底，凡是爱善者所爱的究竟是什么？

sentences.english: Who that knows what his misfortunes have been, can help feeling an interest in him?
sentences.chinese: 凡是知道他的不幸遭遇的人，谁能不关心他？

sentences.english: No man may husband of woman, all wearing a lady's signature.
sentences.chinese: 凡是人尽可夫的女人，都挂着一个淑女的招牌。

sentences.english: The indictment charges that Chung was a willing participant.
sentences.chinese: 起诉书指控钟东凡是一名自愿的参与者。

sentences.english: When a couple gets married, the bride's family usually pays for the reception.
sentences.chinese: 夫妻成婚时，新娘家凡是支付宴会费用。

sentences.english: I am always sure of things I want to be sure.
sentences.chinese: 凡是我想肯定的事情，我从来都敢肯定。

sentences.english: He is pleasured by all who know him.
sentences.chinese: 凡是知道她的人，都很喜欢她。

sentences.english: All those who could sympathise with you were invariably in the same hapless situation.
sentences.chinese: 凡是能表同情的，都是处在同一地位的人。

definition: only if (..., or otherwise, ...)/only when/only in the case that/unless
for the most part/on the whole/also pr. [da4 du1]
for the most part/on the whole/metropolitan
Dadu, capital of China during the Yuan Dynasty (1280-1368), modern day Beijing
must/to need to/to be sure to
to be bound to/to be sure to
